availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William T. Martin (Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Nimrod Martin and Elizabeth Martin. Married to Mary Coit Martin in Woodford County on August 9, 1859. Student in Woodford County in 1850. Farmer in Woodford County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1860. Farmer in Woodford County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District 1, p. 434B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles, p. 825.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles, p. 491B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Woodford County Marriages, Film #000252320.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Woodford County, KY, September 1863, p. 226.
"William T. Martin (1833-1869)," Find A Grave, Memorial #196947144, accessed January 28, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/196947144.
